<yellow except for: black head, black propleuron; hind femur black with yellow patch basally, posterior tip of metasoma black, apex of forewing infuscate>
<yellow>

<black>

<yellow except for: black head; black propleuron; mid tarsus black, hind tibia black apically, hind tarsus black, first four metasomal segments black; forewing infuscate with clear band in apical 3rd quarter of wing\par{}>
<yellow except for: midtarsi black, foretibia black distally, midtarsal segments black; forewing banded from base yellow, infuscate, yellow, infuscate, foremargin of wing infuscate throughout\par{}>

<yellow except for: black head; black propleuron; black fore, mid, hind femur, distal mid tibia black, mid tarsi black, hind coxae black, trochanter black, hind tibia with black patch basally and distally, hind tarsi black; posterior three tergites black; apex of forewing infuscate\par{}>
<orange>

characters.name: \b{}Etymology:\b0{}
data: <the Latin ala meaning wing, and fumida for smokey, because of the entirely infuscate wings of this species.>
<in honor of Andy Boring, a fellow lab worker for being my sounding board.>
<the Latin erudio, for smooth, because the propodeum of this species is smooth, without sculpture>
<In honor of Fernando Fernandez.>
<the Latin flavus for yellow, and cacumen for extreme point, end because of the yellow tipped antennae of this species.>
<the Latin galbus meaning yellow.>
<In honor of my mother, Gloria Lindsay.>
<Named after type locality>
<the Latin niger, meaning black, dark, because of the mostly black bodies of this species>
<the Latin acutus, meaning acute and from the Latin pectus meaning chest because of the extremely acute projection of the propleuron of this species.>
<in honor of Kevin Pitz, a fellow lab worker for answering my annoying questions and setting me straight.>
<the Latin word "planus" meaning smooth, and "funditus" for entirely because of the lack of characteristic carinae of this species>
<in honor of Katja Seltmann, a fellow lab worker, for explaining everything from taking pictures to assembling plates.>
<In honor of Barb Sharanowski, a fellow lab worker and helper of unexperienced undergraduates.>
<named after Suriname inhabitants>
<the Latin variegatus meaning of different sorts; particulary color, due to the color variations of this species>
